description: de- +‎ oculo- +‎ -ate; coined by Charles Lamb in a letter to  William Wordsworth written in 1897: "Dorothy, I hear, has mounted spectacles; so deoculated two of your dearest relations in life. "

verbs.description: deoculate (third-person singular simple present deoculates, present participle deoculating, simple past and past participle deoculated)

entries.meaning: To remove the eyes or their equivalent from
